channel.title: Alpha Plans
channel.description:
After getting all the complaints about the current alpha format, I thought about the alternatives and decided to change how we're doing it. Because people can't seem to understand the layered testing model, we'll be switching to one that tests everything at once.
What this means:
[ul][li]Unfortunately, a public alpha probably wont be available for a while. A few weeks, at the least. I'll want all of the important skills done, and a lot more content outside of that.[/li] [li]However, when the public alpha is out, you guys will get your wish and it will be completely open range. Teleport around, teleport to players, spawn items, set your skills, spam yell, try to break everything you can. Because there is so much more available, there will probably be a lot more bugs to fix. The alpha will be going on for a while, probably until the majority of the bugs are found, even if that's a week or more. One that happens, the server will come off and we will work on fixing the remaining found bugs and prepare for beta![/li] [li]Obviously, accounts will still be wiped at the end of alpha.[/li][/ul]
Sorry to anyone that was looking forward to the test this Saturday, but stay tuned for a list of new content that will be added for the later alpha!

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

David the type of coder to not use brackets in his code because he wants to set it free

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:6, topic:549551”]It is better to test multiple things at once and with full functionality[/quote]Yea, I agree. Zuppers and I are going to work on coming up with a list of pretty much all content in the f2p area and then work from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

It is better to test multiple things at once and with full functionality, good work.

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549551”]We ask for a feature and then the entire project gets delayed…
Okay.[/quote]Project isn’t delayed. Simply changed from staggered alpha testing to a different system. If anything this actually will make beta come sooner because we’ll be spending less time preparing for alphas and more time actually working on content

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

We ask for a feature and then the entire project gets delayed…
Okay.

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:2, topic:549551”]Don’t forget that some bugs hide others. How frequently can you guys deploy? If you script it so it can be deployed from within the IDE then you can do a rolling release rather than saving up the list of bugs, and the alpha can remain ongoing.[/quote]I didn’t mean that I wont be fixing bugs during the alpha, it only takes me about a minute to deploy a new version of the server to the vps. I just meant that if it gets to the point where no more bugs are being found, then I’ll turn it off just so there is some downtime between beta and alpha.

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha Plans
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Don’t forget that some bugs hide others. How frequently can you guys deploy? If you script it so it can be deployed from within the IDE then you can do a rolling release rather than saving up the list of bugs, and the alpha can remain ongoing.

Read full topic
